channel.title: Quick help with this snippet

item.title: Quick help with this snippet
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Now my last question being how to use it with multiple items per “key” or input or whatever you want to call it
Also, if anyone know how to parse strings would be nice, god knows I’m half clueless in java thus far

Read full topic

item.title: Quick help with this snippet
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

if (inputString.startsWith("::kit")) { String[] args = inputString.split(" "); //Integer.parseInt(args[1]); String key = *(args[1]); if (key == "whip") { this.stream.createFrame(59); this.stream.writeDWord(1); this.stream.writeDWord(4151); //itemid this.stream.writeDWord(1); //amount } }The * needs to be replaced, and I’m not 100% sure this will work. I left the * there because I don’t know the method for parsing strings.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick help with this snippet
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I’m using the snippet that, I think marcbob posted? Not sure, but on old PI sources, it lets you spawn items using client-side packets.

if (inputString.startsWith("::item")) { String[] args = inputString.split(" "); int id1 = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int id2 = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); this.stream.createFrame(59); this.stream.writeDWord(1); this.stream.writeDWord(id1); //itemid this.stream.writeDWord(id2); //amount }

Basically, I need help making so you type in ::kit [input] and you basically get items depending on what you put in.
Ex: ::kit pk will give you so many items
I’ll add the ids and shit myself, I just need the command to work off of.
I’ve tried several times, just can’t figure out a couple things.
Sorry it’s not in client help, but I have to go in a hour or so and it takes a while to get help there.

Read full topic
